page.title: 13Bramdean Village Policeman
page.content: The village policeman works from his home in the village, and although attached to a Police Station in the nearest town, he usually works alone, looking after about four parishes. The policeman is responsible for the investigation of crime, for preventing crime by patrolling on foot or motorcycle, and for giving advice to property owners. He also deals with road accidents, investigates sudden deaths, issues firearms licences, teaches road safety in schools, intervenes in violent domestic disputes, checks the conduct of public houses, and performs many other varied tasks. There is an office at his house where people may call when in need of help or advice. When the policeman is off duty, although he can be contacted at home if necessary, his beat is covered by a patrolling car.
